Whether or not to use SSL to reach the Backend
The portion of traffic to send to a specific origins. Each origin receives weight/total of the traffic.

The name of the Azure Blob Storage container in which to store logs
Apache-style string or VCL variables to use for log formatting (default: `%h %l %u %t "%r" %>s %b`)
The version of the custom logging format used for the configured endpoint. Can be either 1 or 2. (default: 2)
The Gzip compression level (default: 0)
How the message should be formatted (default: `classic`)
The unique name of the Azure Blob Storage logging endpoint
The path to upload logs to. Must end with a trailing slash
How frequently the logs should be transferred, in seconds (default: 3600)
Where in the generated VCL the logging call should be placed
The PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk
The name of the condition to apply
The Azure shared access signature providing write access to the blob service objects

A name to refer to this Cache Setting

A number used to determine the order in which multiple conditions execute. Lower numbers execute first
The statement used to determine if the condition is met
Type of the condition, either `REQUEST`, `RESPONSE`, or `CACHE`
